title: Man City face Club Brugge in must - win clash – but who are favourites to triumph ?
body_text:
The Champions League has just one round of fixtures left to play in the new league phase, and there’s plenty still to play for.
Liverpool have breezed through their first seven games, while Arsenal are all but confirmed to reach the last 16.
Manchester City, however, are remarkably still outside the top 24. Anything other than a win against Belgian side Club Brugge will see the 2023 winners eliminated.
And Aston Villa, despite a strong start in this season’s revamped competition, have suffered recent setbacks that have left them outside the top eight and needing a win against Celtic to secure automatic qualification to the knockout stages.
It’s finely poised, with all 36 teams in action on Wednesday evening.
We’ve teamed up with bet365, the first official sports betting partner of the UEFA Champions League, to bring you the latest odds ahead of a major night of football action.

Aston Villa v Celtic
Villa need to win to have any chance of getting into the top eight and clinch an automatic qualification place.
They’ll also be relying on Italian outfit Atalanta either losing or drawing to Barcelona at the Nou Camp, as well as hoping that Monaco, Feyenoord, Lille or Brest don't win by a big margin and overhaul them on goal difference.
The good news is that the Midlanders have won two of their past three Champions League matches at Villa Park. Celtic have failed to gain a single victories from three away games.

Girona v Arsenal
The Gunners are in third place with 16 points, behind Liverpool and Barcelona.
Only a loss to Girona and huge wins for Atalanta, Bayer Leverkusen, Monaco, Feyenoord, Lille and Brest – enough to overturn a significant goal difference – would push Arsenal out of the top eight.
The Catalan side have struggled in their debut Champions League campaign, with just three points from seven matches leaving them in 31st place and unable to qualify for the knockout stages. They’ve also conceded 11 goals.
However, Mikel Arteta’s side have suffered a draw and a loss away from home in this season’s competition.

- To Win to Nil: Girona 9/1 / Arsenal 7/4

- To Win Both Halves: Girona 20/1 / Arsenal 3/1

Man City v Club Brugge
Man City are currently 25th in the table, and can't finish inside the top eight. If they fail to beat Club Brugge, Pep Guardiola’s side will be out.
City have won only one of their past three Champions League matches at Etihad Stadium, while Club Brugge's away record stands at one victory from three games. Their last outing was a home draw with Italian giants Juventus.
Erling Haaland has scored in five of Manchester City’s previous eight home matches in the Champions League, netting eight goals in total.
Full-time result:

- To Win to Nil: Man City 1/1 / Club Brugge 22/1
- To Win Either Half: Man City 1/10 / Club Brugge 9/2
- To Win Both Halves: Man City 6/5 / Club Brugge 50/1
- To Score in Both Halves: Man City 8/13 / Club Brugge 9/1
PSV v Liverpool
PSV are sitting 19th in the Champions League table, clinging on to qualification with 11 points. They’ve won three, drawn two and lost two of their fixtures in this season’s competition.
Meanwhile, table toppers Liverpool have a maximum 21 points, with 15 goals scored and just two conceded.
PSV have scored eight goals across their three home fixtures in the Champions League, and if Arne Slot decides to shuffle his team now that automatic qualification is guaranteed, the Eredivisie leaders have every chance of causing an upset.
